fields.summary: As a user, I would like to be able to select the time range of viewing for the Epic Report, so I can refine the results I am looking at
Browser history 'back' behaviour is broken with Burndown Chart

fields.description: Add ability to configure email notifications when a column constraint (MAX, in particular) is violated in the Green Hopper Kanban boards.
fields.summary: Add ability to configure email notifications when a column constraint (MAX, in particular) is violated in the Green Hopper Kanban boards.

fields.description:
As a Kanban rapid board user, I would like to have the same approach offered by Scrum rapid board - plan view.
Basically, it would be great to be presnted with the same view as plan for scrum (epics on left, backlog center and detail on left) but without sprint/create sprint and so on, maybe replaced with a facility to move to "in progress" status topmost backlog issues as we can do when we create a sprint in scrum mode.
fields.summary: Epic in Kanban rapid boards

fields.description:
In current implementation of Jira Software, a single Epic can support multiple projects as needed. This means that only a single Epic issue type is used for all boards available by default. And due to this configurations, users are not able to create a new Epic issue type, and have different boards to use different Epic.

It will be great if GreenHopper allows users to create multiple Epic issue type, and configure the available boards to use specific Epic issue type as required.

Sample use case:
{quote}In our (and most likely other users) case we have a combination of hardware and software projects. The two project streams are loosely coupled. For the hardware side, the use of the word "Epic" would not feel really natural. Example: 2 Volts power rise within 10 nanoseconds is not an "Epic", it is a "Feature". On the other hand the software that drives the instrument can use the "Epic" terminology. Example: "Device drivers support power-on sequence and self-test of high-speed power card".

Therefore I think it would be great if one could specify per configured board (Kanban or Scrum) which issue type should be considered the "Top Level Hierarchy".
{quote}
fields.summary: Add the ability to create multiple Epic issue type in JIRA Software

fields.description:
created epic, added 1 already estimated story. chart is empty.

also, table at the bottom looks like it has an empty line
fields.summary: Epic chart with single issue shows empty chart

fields.description: This would be nice to have :)

fields.summary: Allow sprint planners to organise sprint windows during planning (before the sprint has started)

fields.description: I noticed when you start a sprint, you have the option on the planning board to collapse a sprint. This feature is also needed during sprint planning (before you start s sprint) to quickly assist in filtering out items. Quick Filters are too complicated and involved to setup all the time.
fields.summary: Allow sprint planners to collapse sprint windows during planning (before the sprint has started)

Both Date Picker and Refine button are specific to CFD and Control Chart.

FYI - "does not delong" is an Atlassian meme.

In this example, there should be lots of issues in the Done column. But there are only two.

There are two issues in the current sprint however...

Error occurs:

Please try refreshing the page, or contact your administrator / Atlassian Support if the problem continues.
Details

Resource: http://localhost:2990/jira/s/en_USh7nrpw-1988229788/6015/4/6.1.2-SNAPSHOT/_/download/resources/com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-rapid/jquery.flot.js
Line: 714
Environment
Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_7_5) AppleWebKit/537.11 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/23.0.1271.101 Safari/537.11
{code}
fields.summary: Javascript error when trying to render CFD chart

fields.description:
In the first screenshot, you see the addition of lots of issues to an epic all within a short time frame. Each issue being added generates one tooltip.

In the second screenshot, you see the bulk transition of some issues to the Done status. It seems that here the tooltips are collapsed, so that multiple events are listed in the one tooltip.

Is there a reason for this difference?
fields.summary: Opinion - Tooltip collapsing not consistent

fields.description:
On Plan Mode, bugs (which do not have story points) are not listed as unestimated, because they are not estimate-able.

On Report Mode, they are treated as unestimated.

We need to be consistent with this categorisation. I personally think we should include bugs, or any issue that cannot have an estimate which is configured for the board, to be counted as "estimated" instead of "unestimated".
fields.summary: Bugs are not consistently categorised as either Estimated or Unestimated

fields.description:
Epic Report on a kanban board is a bit pointless - you can't associate issues to epics because there is no Plan Mode. There is also no estimation statistic configurable on Kanban boards, which cuts out half the information on the chart.

Either we choose to show it and make sure it works with the limited information available, or we do not show it.

*EDIT:* also observe in the attached screenshot that the date range picker appears on this report even though it has no use.
fields.summary: Opinion - Epic Report should not be available on Kanban boards

fields.description: For scrum boards, we promote the Scrum-specific charts as they are most useful. Epic Report should come before Control and Cumulative Flow.
fields.summary: Epic Report should be promoted in list of available charts

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# Visit one board and go to the Epic Report
# Visit another board and go to the Epic Report
# Now go back to the first board by using the Agile menu to choose the board.

You should be taken to the Epic Report on the first board straight away. However, when you use the browser back button, it takes two clicks to get back to the previous board. Also, once you are there, your "forward" history is no longer available.
fields.summary: Strange browser history behaviour when viewing Epic Report

fields.description: Could reproduce it on one board but not another.
fields.summary: Issue count delta on black and blue series is missing

fields.description:

# Assign a story to an epic with a Story Point estimate
# Convert story to a bug

Note that the Summary is updated correctly.
fields.summary: Converting a story to a bug does not create scope change event for loss of Story Points
Epic status report table shows issues which are in unmapped statuses

# Assign some issues to an epic which are in Open status

# Look at the epic report
fields.summary: No chart is displayed if all issues in epic are in unmapped statuses (on this board)

fields.description:
* The black line "unestimated issues" will never be present -- remove from legend?
* The blue line "total issues" will always be the same as the light green line "total estimate" -- remove the blue line from the chart and legend?
* If blue and black lines are removed, also remove the right-hand y-axis series from the chart.
fields.summary: Superfluous information when estimate statistic is Issue Count

fields.description:
To help differentiate the left series from the right, maybe one should use a different line style? This could also be reflected in the legend, to help the user understand the difference between the four data lines/regions.

If possible, it might also be helpful to show the "box" in the legend for a region different to the "box" for a line.
fields.summary: Opinion - suggest using different line style for the second y-axis (issue count)

fields.description:
Current items in legend are:

* Total Estimate
* Complete Estimated Issues
* Total number of issues
* Total number of unestimated issues

We think this is not clear in terms of relating the legend items to the specific y-axis on the chart. Also "Complete Estimated Issues" makes me think "issue count" rather than "Story Points" as the unit of measurement.

Our suggestion:

* Total Story Points (substitute Story Points for the estimation statistic)
* Completed Story Points
* Number of issues
* Number of unestimated issues
fields.summary: Opinion - legend is unclear

fields.description: This will get you the latest licensing code, including some OnDemand changes.
fields.summary: Bump to UPM license API 2.8

fields.description: The reason we bring this up is because, due to the nature of the 'zero' point - the first instant where an issue was associated to the epic - you will always have hover points that basically line up against the y-axis. It might be nicer visually to have some padding between the y-axis and the actual 'zero' point on the x-axis.
fields.summary: Opinion - should the 'zero' point on the x-axis be butted against the y-axis on the left side?

fields.description: See screenshot. Board is configured for Original Time Estimate as estimation statistic.
fields.summary: y-axis ticks are not formatted correctly

fields.description:
There is a separate section in the Sprint Report: Removed issues from the sprint.
But new added tickets just go into Completed/Not Completed sections.

There is no such section as Added issues during the sprint.

The additional section should include a link to the Issue Nav.
fields.summary: Display issues added to the sprint in Sprint Report

fields.description: We tag our issues using labels. Some times these labels are used in quick filter logic. Currently those quick filters only filter the backlog. I'd like for these quick filters to also filter the Epic pane as well. That way I could filter by say, component and see only backlog issues and epics that have been tagged by that particular component.
fields.summary: As an Agile Board user I would like my quick filters to filter epics in the Epic pane as well

fields.description: - this could be an epic filter and/or a separate mini-report showing progress by epic
fields.summary: As Patrick, I want to understand progress of a particular epic within a version to have a more granular understanding of the progress

fields.description: - allow the percentage calculation to be adjusted (default to 10%)
fields.summary: As Patrick, I want to adjust release report projections to simulate and better understand what can be achieved within a version

fields.description:
- the chart needs to show the complete history of a version (incl scope changes) - it's a burnup chart showing total estimate vs complete estimate, total vs unestimated stories
- also display count of unestimated stories
- start date is defined as the day when first story from that version was added to the version (to use startDate once we have it)
- also display the list of stories split into complete, incomplete, incomplete unestimated (we may want to consider adding full history later on);
- each story on the list should display the epic it belongs to

(!) Development Notes (!)

Q: How does the chart look if it has been archived then unarchived again?
A: the same

Q: What if an issue is a part of multiple versions? Are there any implications for which version it is displayed in/ permission issues if this issue is in another project our user has no permissions to see?
A: it's displayed in all of them if the user has permissions to see it

Q: What if epics are in a version, how are they counted and displayed?
A: They are added to the issue count and will show up in the table.

Q: What happens to the chart when the first issue added to the version is deleted/moved/converted?
A: it should show issue removed
fields.summary: As Patrick, I want to understand the progress towards a version with a single report
As Patrick, I want to be able to filter my backlog to a select few versions so I can see which stories will be included in them

fields.description:
Currently, in order to edit the issue attributes like the Assignee, Components, and others in the Agile Board, one would have to manually edit the issue itself.

It would be useful if the user can directly edit it from the Planning Board, like in the Classic Boards.

An example of issue attributes that the user would like to inline edit is shown in the screenshot :

!agile edit.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Allow inline editing of issue attributes in Agile board

fields.description:
* Includes adding "All issues" option for versions AND epics
* Includes adding "Issues without version" option
* Single version selection
* Selected version for filter should be remembered in the URL
* Epic numbers metadata will not be updated when filtering is active
* If an epic filter is active, and then a version filter is activated which excludes that epic, the epic filter will revert back to "All issues" option

(!) Development Notes (!)

Q: So shift or control click do not work for multiple select?
A: (x) Not Answered

Q: What if a quick filter applies a version filter?
A: (x) Not Answered

Q: What if an instant filter is active?
A: (x) Not Answered

Q: Do we want to link the order of versions to the order of issues in the backlog?
A: (x) Not Answered

Q: What if an epic is selected and a version which is empty is selected? Do we still drop all the issues from the filter the same way if issues in the epic aren't in the version?
A: (x) Not Answered

Q: Does the instant filter only filter on the subfiltered issues, or on the entire backlog?
A: (x) Not Answered

Q: What is the hierarchy about how filters are applied now?
A: (x) Not Answered
fields.summary: As Patrick, I want to be able to filter my backlog to a specific version so I can easily see which stories will be included

fields.description:
* Estimate column spacing still honoured
* If there is no epic associated, version lozenge will be right-justified next to estimate
* All version lozenges use the same colour, which is not a colour available to epics
* Truncation assessed by the width (similar to epic lozenges)
* What happens when an issue is associated with multiple fix versions through JIRA?
** Show somehow that there's more than one version on the lozenge
** The primary version is the first unreleased version in the sequence
* Released versions are displayed
* Archived versions are not

(!) Development Notes (!)

Q: What if the version name is very long?
A: it's truncated (via CSS - martin to review)

Q: Shouldn't the primary version in a multi-version be the soonest version, rather than the alphabetical one?
A: (x) it's currently ordered alphabetically, please talk to Tokes / Tom if you think it should be different

Q: How does this play with the epics / DV being open / closed?
A: not affected

Q: How do you remove an issue from a single version if it has multiple?
A: you can't remove a fix version at all

Q: What if one of the versions is / has been released?
A: it still shows up

Q: What if the version is "Archived" in JIRA?
A: (x) Not Answered
fields.summary: As Patrick, I want to see the version assigned to an issue in the list view so I can quickly identify which issues belong to which versions

fields.description:
- permissions
- only one version can be associated with an issue (using this feature): fixVersion is replaced
- can assign multiple issues to a single version easily
- what happens when multiple issues from multiple projects are dragged?
-- don't allow drop on version panel
-- possibly explore additional message or change cursor
- what happens when an issue from PROJA is dropped onto PROJB?
-- don't allow drop on version panel
-- show message
- able to drag issues from active sprints or future sprints or backlog
-- refer to comments below re: dialog when destructively updating

Note:
* IE8 experience may not be as good due to bad drag and drop performance
* consider messaging for invalid drop targets

(!) Development Notes (!)

Q: What if the version list is stale and a version doesn't exist anymore/was archived?
A: (/) We show a "Issue doesn't exist" message and we reload the issues list

Q: What if an issue was converted to a subtask or epic?
A: (/) We attach it anyway

Q: What if the issue is already part of a sprint?
A: (/) We allow it

Q: Need to make sure the issue is not reranked if drop on version fails.
A: (/) We always cancel ranking after drop on versions even if it fails

Q: What if a group of issues is dropped but one or more fail to be added? What happens to the rest and how do we notify the user?
A: (/) We don't update anything and we show a message saying that the user doesn't have the permission to update the issue(s)

Q: Are the dropzones properly hidden when the version tab is hidden?
A: (/) yes

Q: Does drag and drop work well if quick and/or instant filters are on?
A: (/) yes, no direct influence
fields.summary: As Patrick, I want to assign issues to a version

fields.description: - the general idea is for this to mimic the epic functionality
fields.summary: As Patrick, I want to choose a colour for a version so I can identify it easier in the backlog

fields.summary: As Patrick, I want to be able to delete a version

fields.description:
# Dialog is shown
# fields we need to populate: Project, Name, Description, Release Date
# Single Select (with autocomplete aka Frother) Control for project selection
# Description field - text field
# Apply sensible length limits to these input fields (check what limits JIRA has in place if any or just enforce a limit of 255 chars on the front end)
# create version affordance is only displayed if the user has project admin permissions to at least one project (it is the same as can manage sprint logic)
# Analytics to track usage of dialog
#* Also capture length of version names

(!) Development Notes (!)

Q: XSS safe?
A: (/) yes

Q: What if the version name already exists?
A: (/) We show an error message
fields.summary: As Patrick, I want to be able to create a new version

fields.description:
- this refers to the version panel
- the behaviour should mimic the epic panel, including the twixies
- information needed: description, start date, release date as well as count of total, completed and unestimated stories, total estimate units, small progress bar (startDate is not part of the progress calculation)
- for empty data (release date, start date) reuse the same approach as we use on the detail view
fields.summary: As Patrick, I want to be able to see more details about the version when looking at the Versions Panel

fields.description:
Considered versions:
- versions which are BOTH:
-- part of projects included in the board, AND
-- unreleased
-- not archived

Ordering:
- version sequence for versions within the same project (oldest first)
- overall projects are ordered by project name

Display:
- version name along with project key (name on mouse hover)
-- version name wraps around project key, if one or both are long
- if the board only has one project, omit project name

If there are no release versions you get an empty column. In the filters story we'll add an "all releases" button so it doesn't look so empty.

(!) Development Notes (!)

Q: What if there are duplicate version names?
A: They look the same. 

Q: What if the version names are long?
A: They wrap. 

Q: What if a version has been renamed / deleted in the system?
A: It doesn't show up (archived versions dont' show up).

Q: When reordering versions, are they bound to their container?
A: The order can't be changed on this page. 

Q: What can I edit about the versions?
A: Nothing. Nada. Rien. Nope.

Q: What does the detail view display if a version is selected but no issues are selected?
A: There is no selection of a version yet, that's part of the filter story. 

Q: What if the fixVersions field doesn't exist?
A: (x) Not Answered

Q: Is there a way to select another version field to be displayed here?
A: (x) Not Answered

Q: What if the version is "Archived" in JIRA?
A: It isn't included in the list.
fields.summary: As Patrick, I want to see list of versions when I'm looking at the backlog

fields.description: Could we use a spinner or optimistic update?
fields.summary: Lack of feedback when using bulk actions on Plan Mode

fields.description: Shouldn't have multiple section titles, probably just a summary

fields.description: I think I got into this state after adding a leap day, feb 29 2012, as the default behavior was definitely working and staying on the last selected day.
fields.summary: Nonworking day calendar increments by month every time you click add day

fields.description: I think the Sprint Report should show the re-estimated Story Point values too. During the retrospective meeting the story points may be re-estimated. The current Story Point column could be renamed to Original Story Points and next to it could be the Story Points column showing the story point values of the sprint closing.
fields.summary: Sprint Report should show the re-estimated Story Point too

fields.description: When you open an issue in JIRA, you can navigate to several related places by clicking the project icon, and look under "related links". Such functionality is not present when you are on a GH Board and want to navigate to for instance, the wiki of the relevant project, nor is it available when you select an issue from the board, and click the project icon from the issue that shows up in the right section of the screen (similar to normally navigate to an issue) Is this something that can be implemented?
fields.summary: Jumping from GH board to relevant wiki

fields.description: As an administrator, I want to set configurations template for all boards at once. For example, columns configurations template that can be applicable for all boards.
fields.summary: As an administrator, I want to set configurations template for all boards at once

fields.description: E.g. "View Mobile in Issue Navigator" instead of "View all Issues in this Epic in Issue Navigator".
fields.summary: View all issues in issue navigator link should use epic name

fields.description:
Given the situation that there are multiple boards associated to the same project. If a sprint was created in one of the boards, but not started (still in the planning stages), it wouldn't appear in the other boards.

It would only show in the other boards when the sprint has been started.

This can be confusing, as users might clash when trying to create sprints. The user has to know that there are sprints which will be planned by other users.

Also we could use one board for an overall view of the project, and the other boards for views of just specific sprints in the project.
fields.summary: Ability to see planned sprints across boards
As a user, I would like to see a throbber on the Instant Filter so that I know that it is working.

fields.description: Values are rendered as integers instead of time durations, which does occur in the epic report table below.
fields.summary: Estimate aggregates in summary of epic report do not render correctly when estimate statistic is Original Time Estimate

fields.description:
There should be 3 issue navigator links in the Epic report when the estimate statistic is Issue Count:

# for all issues assigned to epic
# for all issues assigned to epic which are done
# for all issues assigned to epic which are not done

The first does not appear.
fields.summary: There is no "View in Issue Navigator" link for the entire epic when the estimation statistic is Issue Count

fields.description:
As a product owner / technical product manager I am using multiple boards every day. Even though I fell in love with the quickfilters, there are several limitations for me:

# I cannot create my own quick filters (I am not the board owner)
# I have to ask the board owner to create quick filters for me (most of them need to be adjusted frequently)
# Even if I ask the board owner for one particular board, the same filters still need to be added to other boards

What I really would like to see is board independent "personal" quick filters that I can setup myself and that are available across boards!
fields.summary: As a product owner I want to use personal quickfilters across boards in addition to board-specific ones

fields.description:
As of now GreenHopper uses the new resolution called 'Done' which is defined in the list of system wide JIRA resolutions.
This is causing additional confusion to people using JIRA since there is already an existing 'Fixed' resolution. It should be configurable in GH to define which resolution should be used while using Simplified Workflow and it will used in the workflows while creating new projects using GreenHopper 'Getting Started' page.
fields.summary: As a Administrator I would like to define the Resolution used in Simplified Workflow

fields.description:
Support request with screenshots: JST-53179

Even if I select a timeframe of 1 week, I still see ALL tasks in Done column, instead of the tasks done in the last week.

This is very confusing for me from usability point of view. I would say that it is either a bug or usability issue.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to quickly filter the CFD chart by the timeframe selected, so that data outside of that time frame does not add to the data I am interested in

fields.description: Per summary, that would be feasible if we can give users more options to disable 'Epics' instead of having it as mandatory option.

fields.description:
For example, if you navigate to this URL:

http://localhost:2990/jira/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=41&view=reporting&chart=epicReport

Or this:

http://localhost:2990/jira/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=41&view=reporting&chart=epicReport&epic=XXXXINVALID

What I expected to happen was for the Epic Report to:
# Choose the last Epic used to display, or the first in the list if there is no last epic (x)
# Rewrite the URL to include that Epic (x)

This does happen with the Sprint Report. (Though the Sprint Report has some different logic about which sprint to display if there is not a valid one in the URL.)

Furthermore, when viewing the Epic in Plan Mode, it has the correct break down of complete/incomplete issues.

fields.description:
When you set the dates for the start and end dates for a sprint, there is a time. 

Can you either remove the time or allow us to change it.  We start sprints on Wed and they end two weeks later, on Tues, end of day. But, the time always shows the current time and it cannot be changed...thus it's quite deceptive, especially if burn down is paying attention to resolved/closed time. 

If there is a valid use case to have time, then please allow us to change it and also, please indicate a timezone.  8:09am in Dallas is not the same for our India team, without the context of CST or CDT.
fields.summary: Unable to change sprint start and end times

fields.description: The title combined with the enclosed screenshot should provide enough insight; i would like the Plan Mode to provide an option to collapse and/or expand upcoming sprints, so the remainder of the issues can be ranked quickly.
fields.summary: As a product owner, i want to be able to collapse (and expand) my upcoming sprints, or the backlog, so i can get a clear overview of my remaining work.
Classic: OnBlur broken for Assignee,Reporter, and Component fields on Planning/Task Boards
The y axis label should state "Days (excluding Non-Working Days)"

fields.description: label tags missing I guess
fields.summary: Cannot click on check box label to toggle option

fields.description:
1. When non working days are excluded from the calculation, there is currently no visual feedback on the chart showing where time was taken out. 

2. When non working days are included in the calculation, the fact that there is a weekend is interesting but a nice to have, because really it doesn't affect the calculation

Currently 1. doesn't show the non working days and 2. shows the non working days which is the wrong way around. We should simply make the chart always show the non working days, as it is necessary in 1. and useful in 2.

Comparing this to the burndown chart: there we never decide whether the non working days affect calculation, as they always do. The switch there is to include/exclude the non working days in the chart display, which as a result then adapts the x-axis scale. In the control chart however, we always show the full scale, which as a result should also show the non working days shaded.
fields.summary: Opinion: non working days shading should always be shown on the control chart

fields.description: Not sure whether this is new or has been there before
fields.summary: GH.ControlChart.Data.compressAxis is really really slow.

fields.description:
Currently the board refreshes but the message stays, which is misleading as the board has properly updated already.

Another bug we've found here - if you see the dialog and wait for about a minute and the go to a different window and return to this one - the view is not updated.
fields.summary: Refresh board message not cleared when board is refreshed as a result of page focusing

fields.description:
Show epic label
Update title from Create Issue to Create issue in epic {epicname}
fields.summary: When creating an issue in an epic (from an epic) show which epic in the Create Issue dialog

fields.description:
* Create a sprint and populate it
* open the same plan mode in a second browser window
* delete the sprint in the second tab
* drag an issue into the deleted sprint in the first window
fields.summary: Can drop issue on stale planned sprints without any error message
Should the "Create Issue" dialog be named "Create Issue in Epic ..."

fields.description:
The new Epics Panel is great, but in a project with many epics it becomes quickly un-manageable, especially if Epics are used (like in our case) to define a roadmap for an entire year.

It would be useful if it was possible to apply filters to the Epics panel (like it's possible to do with the stories now).
fields.summary: As a Product Owner I want to configure the visibility of epics in my Epics Panel In Plan Mode

fields.description:
Spawned from:

https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/120023/board-based-on-filter-with-a-tag-does-not-allow-for-administration-of-sprints-bug-or-feature

When I create a board based on the following sample filter:

(labels = SomeLabel OR project = Project1) ORDER BY Rank ASC

I am unable to administer sprints, even though I have Project Administator permissions. The above query is returning issues that are in 5 projects, if I alter the query to look like this:

(project = Project1 OR ((project = Project2 OR project = Project3 OR project = Project4 OR project = Project5) AND labels = SomeLabel) ) ORDER BY Rank ASC

All works just fine - that is I am now able to administor sprints. Note: the query returns the same number of issues.

Versions:

GreenHopper v6.0.6
Jira: 5.1.3

Basically: base the project list on the returned issues from the filter.
fields.summary: Board's project list should pull in the projects from the filter based on the issues returned

fields.description:
As a user, I don't want the board's filter to be deleted from JIRA which can cause the board to be vanish. This means that it shouldn't be allowed for the board's filter to be deleted from JIRA, this should be only available through GH (Delete Board) and no where else.

P/S: We have received number of customers complaining that they accidentally deleted the board's filter in JIRA which has caused the associated board to be vanish.
fields.summary: As a user, I don't want the board's filter to be deleted from JIRA which can cause the board to be vanish

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce:
# Install JIRA 4.4.3 and GH 5.8.2
# Upgrade JIRA to 4.4.5
# Upgrade JIRA to 5.2.4
# Upgrade  GH to 6.1.1

h3. Expected Results:
Expectation is that GH upgrade tasks complete

h3. Actual Results:
Upgrade tasks fail with the below exception:
{noformat}
2013-01-07 13:30:57,019 pool-8-thread-3 ERROR admin 810x192x1 kufhgi 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1%0 /rest/plugins/1.0/ [net.java.ao.sql] Exception executing SQL update <ALTER TABLE jiraschema.AO_60DB71_RANK_ISSUE_LINK DROP CONSTRAINT pk_AO_60DB71_RANK_ISSUE_LINK_ISSUE_ID>
java.sql.SQLException: 'pk_AO_60DB71_RANK_ISSUE_LINK_ISSUE_ID' is not a constraint.
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

Please refer to our [GreenHopper Upgrade fails due to SQLException: 'pk_AO_60DB71_RANK_ISSUE_LINK_ISSUE_ID' is not a constraint|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/JIRA+Agile+Upgrade+fails+due+to+SQLException%3A+'pk_AO_60DB71_RANK_ISSUE_LINK_ISSUE_ID'+is+not+a+constraint] KB for further information.
fields.summary: Upgrade of GreenHopper Fails

fields.description: "I'm red/green color blind. The thin red/green lines are completely indistinguishable to me. Please allow a choice of colors or use something like blue and orange."
fields.summary: Burndown Chart - allow user selectable colours
